topics.title: Housing squeeze & rents
topics.description: Record-low vacancy rates in Zürich; new ideas like giving priority to Swiss/long-term residents are stirring backlash vs. fair-housing concerns.

candidates.name: Lina Meier
candidates.character: Progressive (left-leaning). Prioritises a stronger social safety net and public services; backs premium relief in LAMal and more cost controls; pro–cooperative/affordable housing; supports closer EU ties incl. a framework agreement; ambitious climate policy (net-zero 2050, public transport, renewables); liberal on migration/asylum with focus on integration; progressive taxation and childcare support; values direct democracy with citizen initiatives to expand social programs.

initial_policy_positions.topic_1: The housing squeeze is a serious issue, and we need bold action. I support expanding affordable and cooperative housing options, along with stronger rent controls to protect tenants. We must avoid measures that discriminate against any residents, as everyone deserves a fair chance at a safe and affordable place to live.

candidates.name: Markus Keller
candidates.character: Conservative (right-leaning). Emphasises free markets and limited government; prefers competition and efficiency in healthcare (managed care, higher deductibles choice) over new subsidies; pro-property rights and deregulation to spur private housing supply; EU-sceptical—prefers bilateral deals without automatic legal alignment; energy security via technology neutrality incl. new-gen nuclear; strict migration controls with faster procedures; supports tax relief and individual taxation; prioritises neutrality, security, and fiscal discipline.

initial_policy_positions.topic_1: The housing shortage is a serious concern, and we need market-based solutions. I support deregulation to encourage private construction and increase housing supply, respecting property rights and avoiding rent controls that stifle investment. Prioritizing residents is problematic; instead, we should streamline permitting, reduce bureaucratic hurdles, and incentivize construction to address the core issue of scarcity.

demographics.name: Andrea P.
demographics.demeanour: Pragmatic and efficient engineer turning research into production-grade software.
demographics.backstory: Software Engineer at AutoForm in Zurich. Formerly ML Application Engineer at Neural Concept, developing surrogate models for engineering simulations.
